Tony Blair, former British prime minister, is prepared to lead Gaza
subhead: Blair, whose consulting firm is working on a development plan for the Gaza Strip, reportedly offered to head a provisional government for the enclave in the event of a peace agreement, according to several media outlets.

title: Moldova's pro-European ruling party wins absolute majority in Parliament
subhead: The Party of Action and Solidarity won more than 50% of the vote after 99% of ballots were counted, giving it 55 out of 101 seats in the Moldovan Parliament. The opposition coalition called for protests on Monday to contest the results in the event of 'fraud.'
byline: By Marine Leduc (Chisinau, Moldova, special correspondent)

title: Night trains linking Paris to Vienna and Berlin to end as France cuts subsidies
subhead: Despite averaging 70% occupancy this year, operators say the services are not financially viable without state support, dealing a blow to Europe's night train revival.

title: 'Zucman tax': The great fear of France's ultra-rich
subhead: Amid budget negotiations, the idea of a tax on the wealth of the ultra-rich is provoking an outcry from those affected, even though it is widely supported by the left and backed by public opinion.

title: How can Europe withstand pressure from Russia and the US? Two experts debate
subhead: Tensions with Russia to the East and the United States to the West are testing Europe's model. Sylvain Kahn and Guillaume Lagane examine this shifting landscape and the possible responses.

title: At Musée d'Orsay, John Singer Sargent, an American in Paris
subhead: While revered by major museums internationally, the painter remains little known in France. Focusing on his Paris years, his first exhibition seeks to correct that oversight.
